message.content:
Investigate the actual detection flow and data transformation in LOOKSMAXX app.

The landmark points are not mapping correctly to faces. Analyze the full data flow:
1. detectFromImageUrl() in mediapipeDetection.ts - how are landmarks extracted?
2. handleAutoDetect() in LandmarkAnalysisTool.tsx - how are detected landmarks stored?
3. Check if landmarks are correctly mapped from MediaPipe indices to custom IDs
4. Verify no data loss or transformation during the flow

Key files:
- src/lib/mediapipeDetection.ts (detectFromImageUrl function)
- src/components/LandmarkAnalysisTool.tsx (handleAutoDetect around line 261)

Trace the exact data flow and identify where coordinates might get corrupted. Report findings.

content.content:
1→/**
     2→ * Face Landmark Detection using MediaPipe Tasks Vision
     3→ * Maps detected landmarks to our custom facial landmarks
     4→ *
     5→ * Uses the shared singleton service for optimal performance
     6→ */
     7→
     8→import { faceDetectionService } from './faceDetectionService';
     9→
    10→// MediaPipe Face Mesh landmark indices (478 landmarks total)
    11→// Reference: https://github.com/google/mediapipe/blob/master/mediapipe/modules/face_geometry/data/canonical_face_model_uv_visualization.png
    12→
    13→// Front profile landmark mapping
    14→export const MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING: Record<string, number> = {
    15→  // Head
    16→  trichion: 10,
    17→
    18→  // Left Eye
    19→  left_pupila: 468,

    46→  right_supercilium_superior: 334,
    47→  right_supercilium_apex: 300,
    48→  right_supercilium_lateralis: 276,
    49→
    50→  // Nose
    51→  nasal_base: 6,
    52→  left_dorsum_nasi: 198,
    53→  right_dorsum_nasi: 420,
    54→  left_ala_nasi: 129,
    55→  right_ala_nasi: 358,
    56→  subnasale: 2,
    57→
    58→  // Mouth
    59→  labrale_superius: 0,
    60→  cupids_bow: 13,
    61→  mouth_middle: 14,
    62→  labrale_inferius: 17,
    63→  left_cheilion: 61,

    66→  // Jaw

    91→
    92→// Side profile landmark mapping
    93→export const MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING: Record<string, number> = {
    94→  vertex: 10,
    95→  external_occipital_region: 10,
    96→  trichion_profile: 10,
    97→  frontalis: 151,
    98→  glabella: 9,
    99→  corneal_apex: 468,
   100→  lateral_eyelid: 33,
   101→  lower_eyelid_profile: 145,
   102→  zygoma_lateralis: 234,
   103→  nasion: 6,
   104→  rhinion: 4,
   105→  supratip: 4,
   106→  pronasale: 1,
   107→  infratip: 2,
   108→  columella: 2,
   109→  subnasale_profile: 2,
   110→  subalare: 129,
   111→  labrale_superius_profile: 0,
   112→  labrale_inferius_profile: 17,
   113→  cheilion_profile: 61,
   114→  sublabiale: 18,
   115→  orbitale: 145,
   116→  gonion_superior_profile: 116,
   117→  gonion_inferior_profile: 172,
   118→  pogonion: 152,
   119→  menton_profile: 152,
   120→  porion: 127,
   121→  tragus: 127,
   122→  intertragic_notch: 127,
   123→  cervical_point: 152,
   124→  neckpoint: 152,
   125→};
   126→
   127→export interface DetectedLandmarks {
   128→  landmarks: Array<{ id: string; x: number; y: number }>;
   129→  confidence: number;
   130→  faceBox: { x: number; y: number; width: number; height: number };
   131→}
   132→
   133→/**
   134→ * Detect facial landmarks from an image URL
   135→ * Uses the singleton FaceDetectionService for optimal performance
   136→ */
   137→export async function detectFromImageUrl(
   138→  imageUrl: string,
   139→  mode: 'front' | 'side'
   140→): Promise<DetectedLandmarks | null> {
   141→  try {
   142→    // Load the image
   143→    const img = await loadImage(imageUrl);
   144→
   145→    // Use the singleton service
   146→    const result = await faceDetectionService.detect(img);
   147→
   148→    if (!result.faceLandmarks || result.faceLandmarks.length === 0) {
   149→      console.log('No faces detected');
   150→      return null;
   151→    }
   152→
   153→    const faceLandmarks = result.faceLandmarks[0];
   154→
   155→    // Select mapping based on mode
   156→    const mapping = mode === 'front' ? MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING : MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING;
   157→
   158→    // Map keypoints to our landmarks
   159→    const landmarks = Object.entries(mapping).map(([id, index]) => {
   160→      // Handle index bounds
   161→      const safeIndex = Math.min(index, faceLandmarks.length - 1);
   162→      const landmark = faceLandmarks[safeIndex];
   163→
   164→      return {
   165→        id,
   166→        // MediaPipe returns normalized coordinates (0-1)
   167→        x: landmark ? landmark.x : 0.5,
   168→        y: landmark ? landmark.y : 0.5,
   169→      };
   170→    });
   171→
   172→    // Calculate face bounding box from all landmarks
   173→    let minX = 1, minY = 1, maxX = 0, maxY = 0;
   174→    faceLandmarks.forEach((lm) => {
   175→      minX = Math.min(minX, lm.x);
   176→      minY = Math.min(minY, lm.y);
   177→      maxX = Math.max(maxX, lm.x);
   178→      maxY = Math.max(maxY, lm.y);
   179→    });
   180→
   181→    return {
   182→      landmarks,
   183→      confidence: 0.95, // MediaPipe doesn't return confidence per landmark
   184→      faceBox: {
   185→        x: minX,
   186→        y: minY,
   187→        width: maxX - minX,
   188→        height: maxY - minY,
   189→      },
   190→    };
   191→  } catch (error) {
   192→    console.error('Face detection error:', error);
   193→    return null;
   194→  }
   195→}
   196→
   197→/**
   198→ * Load an image from URL
   199→ */
   200→function loadImage(url: string): Promise<HTMLImageElement> {
   201→  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
   202→    const img = new Image();
   203→    img.crossOrigin = 'anonymous';
   204→    img.onload = () => resolve(img);
   205→    img.onerror = (e) => reject(e);
   206→    img.src = url;
   207→  });
   208→}
   209→
   210→/**
   211→ * Get the region to zoom into for a specific landmark
   212→ */
   213→export function getLandmarkZoomRegion(
   214→  landmarkId: string
   215→): { centerX: number; centerY: number; zoomLevel: number } {
   216→  const regions: Record<string, { centerX: number; centerY: number; zoomLevel: number }> = {
   217→    // Eyes - zoom in close
   218→    left_pupila: { centerX: 0.35, centerY: 0.35, zoomLevel: 3 },
   219→    left_canthus_medialis: { centerX: 0.4, centerY: 0.35, zoomLevel: 3 },
   220→    left_canthus_lateralis: { centerX: 0.3, centerY: 0.35, zoomLevel: 3 },
   221→    right_pupila: { centerX: 0.65, centerY: 0.35, zoomLevel: 3 },
   222→    right_canthus_medialis: { centerX: 0.6, centerY: 0.35, zoomLevel: 3 },
   223→    right_canthus_lateralis: { centerX: 0.7, centerY: 0.35, zoomLevel: 3 },
   224→
   225→    // Brows
   226→    left_supercilium_apex: { centerX: 0.35, centerY: 0.28, zoomLevel: 2.5 },
   227→    right_supercilium_apex: { centerX: 0.65, centerY: 0.28, zoomLevel: 2.5 },
   228→
   229→    // Nose
   230→    nasal_base: { centerX: 0.5, centerY: 0.4, zoomLevel: 2 },
   231→    subnasale: { centerX: 0.5, centerY: 0.55, zoomLevel: 2.5 },
   232→
   233→    // Mouth
   234→    labrale_superius: { centerX: 0.5, centerY: 0.6, zoomLevel: 2.5 },
   235→    mouth_middle: { centerX: 0.5, centerY: 0.65, zoomLevel: 2 },
   236→
   237→    // Chin
   238→    menton: { centerX: 0.5, centerY: 0.85, zoomLevel: 2 },
   239→
   240→    // Default for other landmarks
   241→    default: { centerX: 0.5, centerY: 0.5, zoomLevel: 1.5 },
   242→  };
   243→
   244→  return regions[landmarkId] || regions.default;
   245→}
   246→

// Helper to get category color for a landmark
export function getLandmarkColor(
  landmarkId: string,
  categories: LandmarkCategory[]
): string {
  for (const category of categories) {
    if (category.landmarks.includes(landmarkId)) {
      return category.color;
    }
  }
  return '#00f3ff'; // Default cyan
}

Now I have a complete picture of the data flow. Let me trace through it and identify the issues.

## Bug Summary

The landmark mapping flow has a critical mismatch between the landmark IDs defined in `SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS` and the IDs used in `MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING`, causing detected landmarks to fail to match and not update positions.

## Root Cause Analysis

### Trace Path

1. **Detection Entry Point** (`LandmarkAnalysisTool.tsx` line 261-285):
   - `handleAutoDetect()` calls `detectFromImageUrl(imageUrl, mode)`
   - Receives `result.landmarks` array with `{id, x, y}` objects
   - Tries to match by ID: `result.landmarks.find(d => d.id === lm.id)`

2. **Detection Function** (`mediapipeDetection.ts` line 137-195):
   - Calls `faceDetectionService.detect(img)` which returns MediaPipe's raw landmarks
   - Selects mapping: `MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING` or `MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING`
   - Maps landmarks (line 159-170):
     ```typescript
     Object.entries(mapping).map(([id, index]) => {
       const landmark = faceLandmarks[safeIndex];
       return { id, x: landmark.x, y: landmark.y };
     });
     ```

3. **The Critical Mismatch** - ROOT CAUSE:
   - `SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS` in `landmarks.ts` defines landmarks with IDs like:
     - `vertex`, `external_occipital_region`, `trichion_profile`, `frontalis`, `glabella`, `corneal_apex`, `lateral_eyelid`, `palpebra_inferior_side`, `orbitale`, `nasion`, `rhinion`, `supratip_break`, `pronasale`, `infratip_lobule`, `columella_nasi`, `subnasale_side`, `subalare`, etc.
   
   - `MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING` in `mediapipeDetection.ts` defines IDs like:
     - `vertex`, `external_occipital_region`, `trichion_profile`, `frontalis`, `glabella`, `corneal_apex`, `lateral_eyelid`, `lower_eyelid_profile`, `zygoma_lateralis`, `nasion`, `rhinion`, `supratip`, `pronasale`, `infratip`, `columella`, `subnasale_profile`, `subalare`, etc.

   **ID Mismatches Found:**
   | landmarks.ts (expected) | mediapipeDetection.ts (actual) |
   |------------------------|-------------------------------|
   | `palpebra_inferior_side` | `lower_eyelid_profile` |
   | (none) | `zygoma_lateralis` |
   | `supratip_break` | `supratip` |
   | `infratip_lobule` | `infratip` |
   | `columella_nasi` | `columella` |
   | `subnasale_side` | `subnasale_profile` |
   | `labrale_superius_side` | `labrale_superius_profile` |
   | `labrale_inferius_side` | `labrale_inferius_profile` |
   | `cheilion_side` | `cheilion_profile` |
   | `pogonion` | `pogonion` (OK) |
   | `menton_side` | `menton_profile` |
   | `gonion_superior_side` | `gonion_superior_profile` |
   | `gonion_inferior_side` | `gonion_inferior_profile` |
   | `zygion_soft_tissue` | (missing) |
   | `porion` | `porion` (OK) |
   | `tragion` | `tragus` |
   | `incisura_intertragica` | `intertragic_notch` |
   | `cervicale` | `cervical_point` |
   | `anterior_cervical_landmark` | `neckpoint` |

4. **For FRONT profile - Similar issues exist:**
   - `FRONT_PROFILE_LANDMARKS` has 52 landmarks
   - `MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING` only defines 45 landmarks
   - Missing mappings for: `left_supercilium_medial_corner`, `left_supercilium_superior`, `right_supercilium_medial_corner`, `right_supercilium_superior`, `cupids_bow`, `left_gonion_superior`, `right_gonion_superior`, `left_mentum_lateralis`, `right_mentum_lateralis`, `left_temporal`, `right_temporal`, `left_auricular_lateral`, `right_auricular_lateral`, `left_cervical_lateralis`, `right_cervical_lateralis`, `left_dorsum_nasi`, `right_dorsum_nasi`, `left_sulcus_palpebralis_lateralis`, `right_sulcus_palpebralis_lateralis`, `left_pretarsal_skin_crease`, `right_pretarsal_skin_crease`

   Wait - there are actually TWO different `MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING` definitions. Let me check again.
   
   In `mediapipeDetection.ts` (lines 14-90): Full mapping with 45+ entries
   In `landmarks.ts` (lines 1012-1060): Partial mapping with ~25 entries
   
   The `detectFromImageUrl` function imports from `mediapipeDetection.ts` and uses its own mapping (lines 14-90), which is more complete but still has mismatched IDs.

## Detailed Findings

### File: `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/lib/mediapipeDetection.ts`

**Issue 1: Side Profile ID Mismatches (lines 93-125)**
The IDs in `MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING` do not match the IDs in `SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS`:


**Issue 2: Missing Side Profile Landmarks**
`MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING` is completely missing:
- `zygion_soft_tissue`

**Issue 3: Front Profile Missing Landmarks (lines 14-90)**
The mapping in `mediapipeDetection.ts` is missing several front profile landmarks that exist in `FRONT_PROFILE_LANDMARKS`:
- `left_supercilium_medial_corner` (has `left_supercilium_medial_corner` but mapped to 66)
- `left_supercilium_superior` (has it mapped to 105)

Actually the front mapping appears complete. The issue is primarily with the side profile.

### File: `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/components/LandmarkAnalysisTool.tsx`

**No data corruption in the component** - The matching logic at line 269 is correct:
```typescript
const detected = result.landmarks.find(d => d.id === lm.id);
```

The problem is upstream - the IDs returned by `detectFromImageUrl()` do not match the IDs expected by `SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS`.

## Fix Required

The `MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING` in `mediapipeDetection.ts` must use the exact same IDs as defined in `SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS` in `landmarks.ts`.

Here is the corrected mapping that should replace lines 93-125 in `mediapipeDetection.ts`:

```typescript
export const MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING: Record<string, number> = {
  vertex: 10,
  external_occipital_region: 10,
  trichion_profile: 10,
  frontalis: 151,
  glabella: 9,
  corneal_apex: 468,
  lateral_eyelid: 33,
  palpebra_inferior_side: 145,  // Changed from lower_eyelid_profile
  orbitale: 145,
  zygion_soft_tissue: 234,       // Added - was missing
  nasion: 6,
  rhinion: 4,
  supratip_break: 4,             // Changed from supratip
  pronasale: 1,
  infratip_lobule: 2,            // Changed from infratip
  columella_nasi: 2,             // Changed from columella
  subnasale_side: 2,             // Changed from subnasale_profile
  subalare: 129,
  labrale_superius_side: 0,      // Changed from labrale_superius_profile
  labrale_inferius_side: 17,     // Changed from labrale_inferius_profile
  cheilion_side: 61,             // Changed from cheilion_profile
  sublabiale: 18,
  gonion_superior_side: 116,     // Changed from gonion_superior_profile
  gonion_inferior_side: 172,     // Changed from gonion_inferior_profile
  pogonion: 152,
  menton_side: 152,              // Changed from menton_profile
  porion: 127,
  tragion: 127,                  // Changed from tragus
  incisura_intertragica: 127,    // Changed from intertragic_notch
  cervicale: 152,                // Changed from cervical_point
  anterior_cervical_landmark: 152, // Changed from neckpoint
};
```

## Regression Test

A test should verify that all IDs returned by `detectFromImageUrl()` match the IDs in `FRONT_PROFILE_LANDMARKS` or `SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS`:

```typescript
import { FRONT_PROFILE_LANDMARKS, SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS } from '@/lib/landmarks';
import { MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING, MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING } from '@/lib/mediapipeDetection';

describe('Landmark ID consistency', () => {
  test('MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING IDs match FRONT_PROFILE_LANDMARKS IDs', () => {
    const expectedIds = new Set(FRONT_PROFILE_LANDMARKS.map(lm => lm.id));
    const mappingIds = Object.keys(MEDIAPIPE_FRONT_MAPPING);
    
    mappingIds.forEach(id => {
      expect(expectedIds.has(id)).toBe(true);
    });
  });
  
  test('MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING IDs match SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS IDs', () => {
    const expectedIds = new Set(SIDE_PROFILE_LANDMARKS.map(lm => lm.id));
    const mappingIds = Object.keys(MEDIAPIPE_SIDE_MAPPING);
    
    mappingIds.forEach(id => {
      expect(expectedIds.has(id)).toBe(true);
    });
  });
});
```

## Prevention

1. Define landmark IDs as a TypeScript enum or union type that is shared between both files
2. Use a single source of truth for landmark definitions
3. Add compile-time type checking to ensure mapping keys match landmark IDs
